alfredsnippet.snippet:
"There is no intrinsic worth to being published in any mainstream, so-called 'peer-reviewed,' publications owned by powerful publishing companies and/or by professional societies, because the lack of integrity in mainstream publication compromises the integrity of the scientific research process."

- Paulo N. Correa, Death By Peer-Review
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Lack of Integrity in Mainstream Publictation
